_header: O orient light and king eterne
_description: Song at the Ascension: poem occurring in only this MS of the English translation of the Pèlerinage de l’âme — five stanzas rhyme royal

MelSLV096G94.First Lines:
O orient lyghte & kinge eterneOure ioye and oure
                    redempcioun…
MelSLV096G94.Last Lines:
…In laude and glorye coequallHonourid with ioye
                    perpetuall
MelSLV096G94.Note:
Transcription from Roberts (1933)
XRoberts,  P. D. 
             “Some unpublished middle English lyrics and Stanzas in a Victoria public
                library manuscript.” 
             English Studies
         54 (1973): 105-18.
